Tent.embed: {"title":"Tent","description":"Standard outdoor tents. Provide protection from the elements of nature. A small one person tent would be about 1m x 1.5m x 1.5m, or 2.25 cubic meters\u2013 meaning 900 in price.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400\/m^3"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Waterproof Lighter.embed: {"title":"Waterproof Lighter","description":"For creating flames in a hurry.  Waterproof.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Flashlight.embed: {"title":"Flashlight","description":"For, you know, seeing. In the dark. Yes.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Waterproof Flashlight.embed: {"title":"Waterproof Flashlight","description":"For, you know, seeing. In the dark. Yes.  Waterproof.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"600"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Water Filter.embed: {"title":"Water Filter","description":"Can ensure that river or pond water is clean to drink after being filtered.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Repel.embed: {"title":"Repel","description":"Lasts 1 hour; causes Pok\u00e9mon of level 15 or lower to flee.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.275"}}

Super Repel.embed: {"title":"Super Repel","description":"Lasts 2 hours; causes Pok\u00e9mon of level 25 or lower to flee.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"300"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.275"}}

Max Repel.embed: {"title":"Max Repel","description":"Lasts 5 hours; causes Pok\u00e9mon of level 35 or lower to flee.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.275"}}

Chemistry Set.embed: {"title":"Chemistry Set","description":"Used to create Repels, Potions, and other objects.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Cooking Set.embed: {"title":"Cooking Set","description":"Used by Chefs to create Snacks and Refreshments.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Dowsing Rod.embed: {"title":"Dowsing Rod","description":"Dowsing Rods have been attuned to the energy resonance given off by Shards and may be used while in any route, cave, or outside area. They may be activated by spending 10 minutes searching an area, and may be activated a number of times per day equal to half of the trainer\u2019s Occult Education Rank.\nRoll 1d6 per Occult Ed Rank. If the area being searched is a beach, cave, desert, or any other sandy\/rocky area, roll +1d6. If you have Skill Stunt (Dowsing), roll an additional 1d6. For each die that results in 4 or higher, you find 1 Shard of a random color: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, or Violet. You may reroll any die that result in 6, gaining that shard and potentially more.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Collection Jar.embed: {"title":"Collection Jar","description":"A simple sealable glass jar. Useful when collecting Items from Pok\u00e9mon, such as Honey from Pok\u00e9mon with the Honey Gather Ability, or MooMoo Milk from Pok\u00e9mon with the Milk Collection Ability. Available almost everywhere.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Sleeping Bag (Double).embed: {"title":"Sleeping Bag (Double)","description":"A standard sleeping bag.  Holds two people.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

First Aid Kit.embed: {"title":"First Aid Kit","description":"Required to use the First Aid Expertise Feature. By Draining 1 AP, any Trainer can make a Medicine Education Check on a target as an Extended Action. The target gains Hit Points equal to the result, and is cured of Burn, Poison, and Paralysis.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Fishing Lure.embed: {"title":"Fishing Lure","description":"Instead of Bait, some trainers may opt to use a Fishing Lure when attempting to Fish. Fishing Lures work just like Bait, but can be used multiple times. If the line snaps or the fish gets away, they may take your lure with them, however.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Saddle.embed: {"title":"Saddle","description":"Saddles help Trainers ride Pok\u00e9mon. They are created with a specific Pok\u00e9mon species in mind, and only Pok\u00e9mon with that body type can wear the saddle. A common Saddle type fits Ponyta, Rapidash, Blitzle, and Zebstrika, for example. Saddles grant a +3 bonus to all Skill Checks made to mount Pok\u00e9mon, or to remain on the Saddle when hit by an attack.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Basic Rope.embed: {"title":"Basic Rope","description":"Basic Fiber Rope. Has a tensile strength of 35 kg or 77 lbs. It has 5 Hit Points.\nRope can only be damaged by Fire-Type attacks, attacks made with sharp objects(knives, swords, sharp teeth), and moves like Scratch, Slash, Leaf Blade, Razor Leaf, etc. The Move Cut ignores all Damage Reduction against Rope. Rope can be bought in any length of 25 ft up to 300.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Utility Rope.embed: {"title":"Utility Rope","description":"Braided Utility Rope. Has a tensile strength of 80 kg or 176 lbs. It has 20 Hit Points and 10 Damage Reduction.\nRope can only be damaged by Fire-Type attacks, attacks made with sharp objects(knives, swords, sharp teeth), and moves like Scratch, Slash, Leaf Blade, Razor Leaf, etc. The Move Cut ignores all Damage Reduction against Rope. Rope can be bought in any length of 25 ft up to 300.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Sturdy Rope.embed: {"title":"Sturdy Rope","description":"Sturdy Rope with a tensile strength of 225 kg or roughly 500lbs. 30 Hit Points and 20 Damage Reduction.\nRope can only be damaged by Fire-Type attacks, attacks made with sharp objects(knives, swords, sharp teeth), and moves like Scratch, Slash, Leaf Blade, Razor Leaf, etc. The Move Cut ignores all Damage Reduction against Rope. Rope can be bought in any length of 25 ft up to 300.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Sleeping Bag.embed: {"title":"Sleeping Bag","description":"A standard sleeping bag.  Holds one person.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Orange Shard.embed: {"title":"Orange Shard","description":"Associated with Normal, Fighting, & Dragon.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Shiny Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Green Shard.embed: {"title":"Green Shard","description":"Associated with Bug, Grass, & Ground.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Leaf Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Poffin Mixer.embed: {"title":"Poffin Mixer","description":"A Poffin Mixer can be used by any Trainer to create Poffins. You simply insert cooking ingredients worth $500, and at least one of the listed berries. You create two Poffins that raises the Contest Stat most represented by the berries used by +1 Contest Die. Some Berries can raise multiple Contest Stats; you choose which to raise when using these Berries to make Poffins. Poffins can be purchased for $500 in bakeries.\nCheri, Figy, Razz, Spelon and Belue Berries raise Cool; Chesto, Wiki, Bluk, Spelon and Pamtre Berries raise Beauty; Pecha, Mago, Nanab, Pamtre, and Watmel Berries raise Cute; Rawst, Aguav, Wepear, Watmel, and Durin Berries raise Smart; Aspear, Iapapa, Pinap, Durin, and Belue Berries raise Tough.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Egg Warmer (Item).embed: {"title":"Egg Warmer","description":"Egg Warmers are insulated cases that carry up to four Pok\u00e9mon Eggs and protect them from harm. They also cause Pok\u00e9mon to hatch twice as fast; each day spent in an Egg Warmer counts as 2 days for the purposes of Hatch Rate.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Tool Box.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Tool Box","description":"These tool boxes let those with the know-how craft and repair Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Portable Grower.embed: {"title":"Portable Grower","description":"Portable Growers can be used to grow berries and herbs. Portable Growers protect the plants within them from external weather, and never need to be fertilized. Each Grower holds one plant.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

The Joy of Cooking.embed: {"title":"The Joy of Cooking","description":"A cookbook for novice and experienced chefs alike.\nRank 1 - Novice General Education: Your material costs for crafting Food Items of any variety are reduced by 10%.\nRank 2 - Expert General Education: Meal and Refreshment Items you create cause whoever eats them to gain a Tick of Hit Points.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.7"}}

Groomer's Kit.embed: {"title":"Groomer's Kit","description":"Used by Trainers with the Groomer Edge to clean their Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Poffin.embed: {"title":"Poffin","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500}],"description":"Raises one Contest Stat by +1 Contest Die. See Poffin Mixer for details on stat selection.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Red Shard.embed: {"title":"Red Shard","description":"Associated with Fire, Fairy, & Psychic.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Fire Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Magic Flute.embed: {"title":"Magic Flute","description":"Magic Flutes are rare artifacts made only by skilled crafters with occult knowledge. They are not usually found in stores. When a Flute is crafted, it is tied to a particular Status Condition. Once per day, the Flute may be played as a Standard Action. All Pok\u00e9mon and Trainers within 20 meters of the Flute are cured of that Status. These rare artifacts cannot be found in most ordinary stores but may cost upwards of $4000 from an appropriate occult vendor.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Item"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Violet Shard.embed: {"title":"Violet Shard","description":"Associated with Poison, Dark, & Ghost.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Dusk Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Mulch.embed: {"title":"Mulch","description":"Mulch may be used to temporarily increase soil Quality; it may be applied to a Plant to increase the Soil Quality of a plant by +1 for the following day. This cannot make a Soil Quality go above +2.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.280"}}

Vile Bait.embed: {"title":"Vile Bait","description":"Vile Bait is a strong-smelling morsel of food designed to attract Pok\u00e9mon. Pok\u00e9mon that eat it are poisoned.\nTo lure Pok\u00e9mon, set the vile bait on a route. Every 15 minutes thereafter, roll 1d20 until you roll 15 or higher. If you roll 3 times without success, the vile bait loses its potency and fails. If you succeed however, a random Pok\u00e9mon will appear. Vile bait is often used for Fishing in this way.\nTo distract Pok\u00e9mon, throw it at a Wild Pok\u00e9mon as a Standard Action. The target must then make a Focus Roll with a DC of 12. If they fail, the Pok\u00e9mon gives up its next Standard Action to eat the food.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Yellow Shard.embed: {"title":"Yellow Shard","description":"Associated with Electric, Rock, & Steel.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Thunder Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Blue Shard.embed: {"title":"Blue Shard","description":"Associated with Water, Ice, & Flying.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Water Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Reanimation Machine.embed: {"title":"Reanimation Machine","description":"Can be used to revive Fossils. Reanimation Machines also come in a smaller but more expensive Portable variety. Prices are up to GM discretion, often upwards of $10,000. See the Pok\u00e9mon Fossils section for more details (page 216).","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"Varies"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Dowsing for Dummies.embed: {"title":"Dowsing for Dummies","description":"A favorite of rock collectors everywhere, this book teaches the user how to attune their dowsing rods.\nRank 1 - Novice Occult Education: Roll +1d6 when searching for Shards.\nRank 2 - Adept Occult Education: When you begin searching for Shards, you may choose to expend an additional activation of Dowsing for the day. If you do, choose a Shard Color; all the Shards you find during this search will be of the chosen Color.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Meadow Plate.embed: {"title":"Meadow Plate","description":"Acts as both a Grass Booster and a Grass Brace. Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Normal Plate.embed: {"title":"Normal Plate","description":"Acts as both a Normal Booster and a Normal Brace. Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Fishing 101.embed: {"title":"Fishing 101","description":"A good way to waste an afternoon sitting at the side of a boat.\nRank 1 - Novice Survival: You gain the Snare Capture Technique, but it only applies to Pok\u00e9mon you have fished up.\nRank 2 - Adept Survival: Whenever you fish up a Pok\u00e9mon, choose two Combat Stats. That Pok\u00e9mon becomes Flinched and loses 1 Combat Stage in each of the chosen Stats.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}

Travel Guide.embed: {"title":"Travel Guide","description":"A Travel Guide covers a specific location, such as a mountain or a pair of routes in the wilderness. Travel Guides are usually written for the more popular destinations in a region, but they might not necessarily exist for more obscure and out of the way locations.\nRank 1 - Novice Survival: You gain the following Skill Stunts while traveling in the studied location: Survival (Foraging) and Survival (Navigation).\nRank 2 - Expert Survival: You and your Pok\u00e9mon do not take damage from naturally occurring Weather effects in the studied location.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}

First Aid Manual.embed: {"title":"First Aid Manual","description":"A training manual given to all EMTs.\nRank 1 - Novice Medicine Education: You gain a +10 Bonus to Medicine Education Checks made to use a First Aid Kit.\nRank 2 - Expert Medicine Education: You may use the First Aid Expertise Feature once per day.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Pok\u00e9mon Daycare Licensing Guide.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9mon Daycare Licensing Guide","description":"This book teaches advanced Pok\u00e9mon Breeding techniques.\nRank 1 - Adept Pok\u00e9mon Education: When Breeding Pok\u00e9mon of this Book\u2019s Egg Group, you may choose which parent\u2019s species the Egg is of.\nRank 2 - Master Pok\u00e9mon Education: When hatching Eggs of Pok\u00e9mon of this Book\u2019s Egg Group, the hatched Pok\u00e9mon learns their first Inheritance Move at Level 10 instead of Level 20.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}

A Field Guide to Fungi.embed: {"title":"A Field Guide to Fungi","description":"This book tells you which mushrooms are good to eat and which ones will give you a bad trip.\nRank 1 - Novice Survival: You automatically identify all Tiny Mushrooms, Big Mushrooms, and Balm Mushrooms you pick. Whenever you or your Pok\u00e9mon consume one of those Mushrooms, they ignore the negative effect of the Mushroom (Hit Point loss, Poison, Combat Stage loss).\nRank 2 - Adept Survival: You can create the Hearty Meal Chef Recipe as an Extended Action but only by using Mushrooms as ingredients.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}

Zinc.embed: {"title":"Zinc","description":"Raise the user\u2019s Special Defense Base Stat 1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

How To Avoid Being Spooked.embed: {"title":"How To Avoid Being Spooked","description":"A questionable old tome filled with Ghost-related esoterica.\nRank 1 - Adept Occult Education: While holding a Cleanse Tag in your Main or Off-Hand Equipment Slot, you can see Pok\u00e9mon and Trainers using the Invisibility Capability.\nRank 2 - Expert Occult Education: While holding a Cleanse Tag in your Main or Off-Hand Equipment Slot, you are immune to the Cursed Status Affliction.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Type Study Manual.embed: {"title":"Type Study Manual","description":"These Books focus on one particular Pokemon Type.\nRank 1 - Novice Pok\u00e9mon Education: You gain a -5 Bonus on Capture Checks against the studied Type.\nRank 2 - Expert Pok\u00e9mon Education: When you apply Experience Training, you may choose to give one of your Pok\u00e9mon of the studied Type +10 Bonus Experience. The same Pok\u00e9mon cannot be chosen two days in a row.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}

Revive.embed: {"title":"Revive","description":"Revives fainted Pok\u00e9mon and sets to 20 Hit Points","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"300"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Heal Powder.embed: {"title":"Heal Powder","description":"Cure all Persistent Status Afflictions \u2013 Repulsive","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Revival Herb.embed: {"title":"Revival Herb","description":"Revives Pok\u00e9mon and sets to 50% Hit Points - Repulsive","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.281"}}

X Attack.embed: {"title":"X Attack","description":"Increases the Pok\u00e9mon\u2019s Attack by two Combat Stages","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

X Defend.embed: {"title":"X Defend","description":"Increases the Pok\u00e9mon\u2019s Defense by two Combat Stages","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

X Special.embed: {"title":"X Special","description":"Increases the Pok\u00e9mon\u2019s Special Attack by two Combat Stages","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

X Speed.embed: {"title":"X Speed","description":"Increases the Pok\u00e9mon\u2019s Speed by two Combat Stages","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Dire Hit.embed: {"title":"Dire Hit","description":"Increases Critical Hit Range of all moves by +2.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"600"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Poultices.embed: {"title":"Poultices","description":"Poultices are applied as Extended Actions on Pok\u00e9mon or Trainers. Poultices last for 6 hours; while applied, they double the Natural Healing Rate of Pok\u00e9mon or Trainers, meaning a Pok\u00e9mon or Trainer will heal 1\/8th of their Hit Points per half hour. Poultices also immediately heal one Injury if they remain in place for their full duration.\nIf a Pok\u00e9mon is damaged or loses Hit Points in any way, the Poulticess immediately stop working.  Poultices are itchy and irritating to the skin and may cause loyalty loss.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"225"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.277"}}

HP Up.embed: {"title":"HP Up","description":"Raise the user\u2019s HP Base Stat 1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Protein.embed: {"title":"Protein","description":"Raise the user\u2019s Attack Base Stat 1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Iron.embed: {"title":"Iron","description":"Raise the user\u2019s Defense Base Stat 1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Calcium.embed: {"title":"Calcium","description":"Raise the user\u2019s Special Attack Base Stat 1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

X Sp. Def.embed: {"title":"X Sp. Def.","description":"Increases the Pok\u00e9mon\u2019s Special Defense by two Combat Stages","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Diancite.embed: {"title":"Diancite","description":"Mega Evolves Diancie when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Heracronite.embed: {"title":"Heracronite","description":"Mega Evolves Heracross when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

DIY Engineering.embed: {"title":"DIY Engineering","description":"Duct tape not included.\nRank 1 - Novice Technology Education: Your material costs for crafting items crafted from Mechanical Scrap are reduced by 10%.\nRank 2 - Expert Technology Education: Whenever you Scrap an Item you created, you gain Scrap worth 75% of its monetary cost instead of only 50%.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.10"}}

Combat Medic's Primer.embed: {"title":"Combat Medic's Primer","description":"\nRank 1 \u2013 Novice Medicine Education: After taking a Sprint Maneuver, you may apply a Restorative Item on an adjacent target as a Swift Action.\nRank 2 \u2013 Expert Medicine Education: Once per Scene as a Standard Action, you may target an adjacent ally. The target may immediately Take a Breather as a Full-Action Interrupt if they wish. They do not Shift and do not become Tripped as part of this action. If the target is Confused or Enraged, you must make a Medicine Education Check with a DC of 12 for them to be able to Take a Breather.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept: p.7"}}

Full Restore.embed: {"title":"Full Restore","description":"Heals a Pok\u00e9mon for 80 Hit Points and cures any Status Afflictions","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1450"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Tyranitarite.embed: {"title":"Tyranitarite","description":"Mega Evolves Tyranitar when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Prescient Powder.embed: {"title":"Prescient Powder","description":"An illegal and dangerous substance produced by desert-dwelling Steelix. Taking the drug inflicts 3 injuries on the user and allows them to use either a Scry or Augury once. The user also gains the Psychic Navigator Edge for two hours. Habitual use of the drug can lead to addiction and health problems.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2500"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

Mawilite.embed: {"title":"Mawilite","description":"Mega Evolves Mawile when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Carbos.embed: {"title":"Carbos","description":"Raise the user\u2019s Speed Base Stat 1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Heart Booster.embed: {"title":"Heart Booster","description":"The Pok\u00e9mon gains 2 Tutor Points. Use only one per Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"9800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

PP Up.embed: {"title":"PP Up","description":"Raise one of the user\u2019s Move\u2019s Frequency one level. Use only one per Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"9800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Anti-Radiation Pills.embed: {"title":"Anti-Radiation Pills","description":"An advanced version of the real life potassium iodide pills. These not only protect the thyroid but instead guard against all forms of radiation poisoning, granting the user Hazard Immunity for radioactive environments only for 24 hours.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

Rambo Roids.embed: {"title":"Rambo Roids","description":"The user treats their Power Capability as increased by 2 for the next hour. However, each time they lift an object or perform a feat of strength beyond their normal means, they must make an Athletics check with a DC of 12. If they fail, they take an Injury immediately. Each such feat of strength induces a cumulative -1 penalty to these Athletics checks.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"750"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

White Light.embed: {"title":"White Light","description":"So named for the soft white glow the liquid gives off, White Light is a crude \u201ctruth serum\u201d. It is slow-acting, taking upwards of an hour to take full effect on a victim. The victim becomes more suggestible and gullible. All of their Guile, Intuition, and Focus Checks made during an interrogation are subject to a -5 penalty.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.48"}}

Spritz Spray.embed: {"title":"Spritz Spray","description":"A drug that improves reflexes at the cost of mental focus. The user of Spritz gains +5 initiative and +1 Evasion for the next 5 rounds of combat but suffers a -3 penalty to Perception and Focus checks for the next hour.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"250"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.48"}}

Soldier Pill.embed: {"title":"Soldier Pill","description":"A potentially dangerous stimulant that provides the user enough energy to go 24 hours without sleep. Upon taking the pill twice in a 48 hour period, the user begins to take 1 injury every 2 hours until they choose to go to sleep. The user of a Soldier Pill gets a +3 bonus to rolls to wake up from Sleep.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"750"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.48"}}

Shock Syringe.embed: {"title":"Shock Syringe","description":"This drug enhances the sensitivity of the user\u2019s nerves, enhancing their perception and making it incredibly useful for scouts and recon missions. However, the enhanced sense of touch greatly lowers the user\u2019s pain tolerance. The user gains a +3 bonus to Perception, Focus, and Guile and a +1 bonus to Accuracy. However, each time the user takes an Injury, they are Flinched. The effects of Shock Syringe last for an hour.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.48"}}

Heart Scale.embed: {"title":"Heart Scale","description":"Can be used to make Heart Boosters.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Sablenite.embed: {"title":"Sablenite","description":"Mega Evolves Sableye when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Rare Candy.embed: {"title":"Rare Candy","description":"These very rare treats are created from Shuckles that have held a Berry for a long time. When ingested by a Pok\u00e9mon, the eater gains enough experience to reach its next Level. Pok\u00e9mon may benefit from up to five Rare Candies in their lifetime.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"9800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Stat Suppressants.embed: {"title":"Stat Suppressants","description":"These medicines have an identical effect to the Suppressant Berries \u2013 they lower one of the user\u2019s Base Stats by 1 point and only function if the Trainer of the Pok\u00e9mon wants them to.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Oxygenation Vial.embed: {"title":"Oxygenation Vial","description":"These vials contain a solution of oxygen-encasing lipids that are injected directly into the bloodstream. One injection is enough to allow the user to go without breathing for up to thirty minutes. Subsequent injections extend the effect, but each one after the first in a 24 hour period causes the user to take one injury as their body suffers complications from the imbalance caused by the solution. These are often carried as a last resort device for astronauts and deep sea divers, as well as used by EMTs to stabilize patients.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

Locus Lozenge.embed: {"title":"Locus Lozenge","description":"A drug to help the user focus on a single task. The user gains a +3 bonus to Focus and Intuition checks for the next hour but suffers a -4 penalty to Perception checks to notice outside events.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

Berserker Bolus.embed: {"title":"Berserker Bolus","description":"A combat drug used by street gangs. Dimensional Field Analyzer.embed: {"title":"Dimensional Field Analyzer","description":"A handheld device the size of a Geiger counter for campaigns featuring time travel or interdimensional travel of some other sort. Spicy Wrap.embed: {"title":"Spicy Wrap","description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when making a Physical attack to deal +5 additional Damage. If the user prefers Spicy Food, it deals +10 additional Damage instead. If the user dislikes Spicy Food, they become Enraged.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Sour Candy.embed: {"title":"Sour Candy","description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when being hit by a Physical Attack to increase their Damage Reduction by +5 against that attack. If the user prefers Sour Food, they gain +10 Damage Reduction instead. If the user dislikes Sour Food, they become Enraged.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Big Root.embed: {"title":"Big Root","description":"HP stealing moves restore double HP. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Salty Surprise.embed: {"title":"Salty Surprise","description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when being hit by an attack to gain 5 Temporary Hit Points. If the user likes Salty Flavors, they gain 10 Temporary Hit Points Instead. If the user dislikes Salty Food, they become Enraged.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Dry Wafer.embed: {"title":"Dry Wafer","description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when making a Special attack to deal +5 additional Damage. If the user prefers Dry Food, it deals +10 additional Damage instead. If the user dislikes Dry Food, they become Enraged.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Bitter Treat.embed: {"title":"Bitter Treat","description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when being hit by a Special Attack to increase their Damage Reduction by +5 against that attack. If the user prefers Bitter Food, they gain +10 Damage Reduction instead. If the user dislikes Bitter Food, they become Enraged.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Sweet Confection.embed: {"title":"Sweet Confection","description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff to gain +4 Evasion until the end of their next turn. If the user prefers Sweet Food, they gain +4 Accuracy as well. If the user dislikes Sweet Food, they become Enraged.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Hearty Meal.embed: {"title":"Hearty Meal","description":"When consumed, that Trainer gains +2 to their Max AP until the end of their next extended rest. A Trainer may only be under the effect of one Hearty Meal at a time. Hearty Meals not consumed within 20 minutes of being created lose all flavor and all effect.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

White Herb.embed: {"title":"White Herb","description":"Any negative Combat Stages are set to 0.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"300"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.281"}}

Tiny Mushroom.embed: {"title":"Tiny Mushroom","description":"The user loses 5 HP, and gains +1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.281"}}

Choice Items.embed: {"title":"Choice Items","description":"Choice Items are tied to a Specific Stat. While worn, the default state of the Stat is +2 Combat Stages instead of 0. However, the user is Suppressed and cannot be cured until the end of Combat, even if the item is removed. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Balm Mushroom.embed: {"title":"Balm Mushroom","description":"The user is cured of Burn, Paralysis, or Poison. If they are, they lose 1 Combat Stage in a random Stat.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.281"}}

Contest Fashion.embed: {"title":"Contest Fashion","description":"These Items have a chosen Contest Stat; Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. When held, once per Contest, the holder may re-roll any 1s made when using a Move of the chosen Type. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Contest Accessory.embed: {"title":"Contest Accessory","description":"The user rolls +2d6 during the Introduction Stage of a Contest. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Bright Powder.embed: {"title":"Bright Powder","description":"+2 to Speed Evasion. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Big Mushroom.embed: {"title":"Big Mushroom","description":"The user becomes Poisoned; if they do, they gain +1 Combat Stage in two random Stats.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.281"}}

Eviolite.embed: {"title":"Eviolite","description":"Only affects not-fully-evolved Pok\u00e9mon of a single family, decided when the Eviolite is made. Grants a +5 Bonus to two different Stats, after Combat Stages, decided when the Eviolite is made. Prevents Pok\u00e9mon from evolving when held. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Focus Band.embed: {"title":"Focus Band","description":"Whenever the user faints, roll 1d20. Once a Scene on a result of 16+, the holder does not faint, and is left with 1 Hit Point. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4700"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Razor Fang.embed: {"title":"Razor Fang","description":"The holder\u2019s damaging attacks cause an Injury on a roll of 19+. Accessory Item for Trainers. Evolves Gligar.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Focus Sash.embed: {"title":"Focus Sash","description":"Once a Scene, if damage from a Move would take Focus Sash\u2019s holder\u2019s Hit Points from Max to 0 or less, Focus Sash\u2019s holder instead has 1 Hit Point remaining. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4700"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Full Incense.embed: {"title":"Full Incense","description":"The holder gains the Stall ability. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Go-Goggles.embed: {"title":"Go-Goggles","description":"The user does not take damage from Sandstorm. Head Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

King's Rock.embed: {"title":"King's Rock","description":"Attacks cause Flinch on a roll of 19+. This does not stack with any abilities, moves, or effects that extend flinch rate. Head Item for Trainers. Evolves Poliwhirl, Slowpoke.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Stat Boosters.embed: {"title":"Stat Boosters","description":"These items have a chosen Stat, either Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, Speed, Evasion, or Accuracy. These items cause the default Stage of their linked Stat to be +1 Combat Stage instead of 0, or simply +1 for Accuracy and Evasion. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Lax Incense.embed: {"title":"Lax Incense","description":"+1 to all Stat Evasions. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Luck Incense.embed: {"title":"Luck Incense","description":"Grants +1 Bonus to all Accuracy Rolls. A roll of 1 always misses. Cannot be used by Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Safety Goggles.embed: {"title":"Safety Goggles","description":"The holder is immune to Moves with the Powder Keyword. Accessory or Head Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Shell Bell.embed: {"title":"Shell Bell","description":"Whenever the user damages a foe, they gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"5200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Puissance Pellet.embed: {"title":"Puissance Pellet","description":"This painkiller and adrenaline injection lets the user temporarily ignore their debilitating injuries. A user with 5 or more injuries does not suffer Hit Point loss equal to their number of injuries when taking Standard Actions. If you are using the optional rule to decrease combat stages for each Injury, the user ignores these combat stage losses. This effect lasts for 5 turns, and at the end of the effect, the user automatically takes another injury.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"450"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

Expert Belt.embed: {"title":"Expert Belt","description":"Whenever the holder deals Super Effective Damage, they deal an additional 5 damage (this damage is not multiplied). Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Flame Orb.embed: {"title":"Flame Orb","description":"Induces burn on holder. Off-Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Lagging Items.embed: {"title":"Lagging Items","description":"The Lagging Items are tied to a specific Stat. When held, they set that Stat to -4 Combat Stages. Cannot be used by Trainers. Standard Action to drop.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Life Orb.embed: {"title":"Life Orb","description":"Whenever the holder deals direct damage, increase the damage by +5, and then the holder loses Hit Points equal to 1\/16th of their Max Hit Points. Off-Hand Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3700"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Razor Claw.embed: {"title":"Razor Claw","description":"The holder\u2019s damaging attacks have their Critical Hit Range extended by +1. Evolves Sneasel.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Shock Collar.embed: {"title":"Shock Collar","description":"Comes with a remote activator, which when pressed, causes the Pok\u00e9mon or Trainer wearing the shock collar to lose Hit Points equal to 1\/6th of their Max Hit Points. This may be used to activate the \u201cPress\u201d Feature. Collars that work on Ground Type Pok\u00e9mon are available for an additional $500.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Iron Ball.embed: {"title":"Iron Ball","description":"The Holder\u2019s Speed is halved, and any immunity to Ground Type is lost. Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"900"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Quick Claw.embed: {"title":"Quick Claw","description":"The user adds +10 to their Initiative. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Toxic Orb.embed: {"title":"Toxic Orb","description":"Induces Poison on holder. Off-Hand Item for Trainers. Standard Action to drop.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Type Boosters.embed: {"title":"Type Boosters","description":"These items come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and grants a +5 Damage Bonus to all direct damage Moves of its Specific Type when performed by the user. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1800"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Type Brace.embed: {"title":"Type Brace","description":"These items come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and grant the holder 15 Damage Reduction against that specific Type. Accessory Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Caretaker's Manual.embed: {"title":"Caretaker's Manual","description":"An invaluable guide to patient care with wide appeal and praised by both nurses and rangers.\nRank 1 - Adept Medicine Education: Once per Scene, you may assist an adjacent ally in Taking a Breather as a Standard Action, and they do not Shift or become Tripped as part of this action. If the target is Confused or Enraged, you may roll Medicine Education instead of Command to assist them.\nRank 2 - Master Medicine Education: This effect can only be bound while taking an Extended Rest and Drains AP for the next day. During this Extended Rest, Pok\u00e9mon and Trainers in your care heal twice as many Hit Points while resting, heal Injuries twice as quickly, and may heal an additional Injury per day. This stacks with use of Bandages.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Technical Manual.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Technical Manual","description":"Your all-in-one guide to balls.\nRank 1 - Novice Technology Education: Your material costs for crafting Poke Balls of any variety are reduced by 10%.\nRank 2 - Expert Technology Education: Poke Balls you craft gain a +2 Bonus to Accuracy Rolls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}

Super Bait.embed: {"title":"Super Bait","description":"Super Bait is a tasty, strong-smelling morsel of food designed to attract Pok\u00e9mon. It may be used in two ways; to lure Pok\u00e9mon, or to distract Pok\u00e9mon.\nTo lure Pok\u00e9mon, set the super bait on a route. Every 15 minutes thereafter, roll 1d20+Intuition Rank until you roll 15 or higher. If you roll 3 times without success, the super bait loses its potency and fails. If you succeed however, a random Pok\u00e9mon will appear. Super bait is often used for Fishing in this way.\nTo distract Pok\u00e9mon, throw it at a Wild Pok\u00e9mon as a Standard Action. The target must then make a Focus Roll with a DC of 12. If they fail, the Pok\u00e9mon gives up its next Standard Action to eat the food.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Elegant Fashion.embed: {"title":"Elegant Fashion","description":"The holder may activate this item once a Scene as a Free Action when losing Combat Stages from a foe\u2019s effect to instead not lose those Combat Stages.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.138"}}

Type Gem.embed: {"title":"Type Gem","description":"These items come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and are consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one attack of their Type. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Type Plates.embed: {"title":"Type Plates","description":"These Rare items come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and act as both a Type Booster and a Type Brace. Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Draco Plate.embed: {"title":"Draco Plate","description":"Acts as both a Dragon Booster and a Dragon Brace. Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Dread Plate.embed: {"title":"Dread Plate","description":"Acts as both a Dark Booster and a Dark Brace. Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Banettite.embed: {"title":"Banettite","description":"Mega Evolves Banette when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Spray Case.embed: {"title":"Spray Case","description":"A Spray Case may be filled with a Pester Ball or Repel of any variety. This consumes the used item. Upon hitting a target, the Spray Case is emptied, spraying the item it was filled with onto its target, automatically hitting. This can occur when attempting to catch Pok\u00e9mon (the effect is resolved before the capture roll), or when releasing a Pok\u00e9mon from its Pok\u00e9 Ball (the effect is resolved before the Pok\u00e9mon within is released). Spray Cases may be refilled numerous times, but may only have one sort of consumable in them at a time.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Storage Case.embed: {"title":"Storage Case","description":"These extremely useful cases are capable of \u201cCapturing\u201d non-living matter. Once applied to a Pok\u00e9 Ball, Storage Cases cannot be removed. The object or objects in question must be smaller than 2 meters in any dimension. A single Storage Case can capture several discrete objects, but they must all be supported by a single surface; a 2x2 meter rug or mat is often used for this purpose. Capture Rolls against inanimate objects automatically succeed. Pok\u00e9 Balls with Storage Cases count towards the total number of Pok\u00e9mon that the trainer can carry. Storage Cases are often illegal due to their uses in smuggling and theft.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"15000"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Earth Plate.embed: {"title":"Earth Plate","description":"Acts as both a Ground Booster and a Ground Brace. Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Rad Fashion.embed: {"title":"Rad Fashion","description":"The holder may activate this item once a Scene as a Free Action to gain a +4 bonus to a single Save Check.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.138"}}

Moon Ball.embed: {"title":"Moon Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target evolves with an Evolution Stone.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Nest Ball.embed: {"title":"Nest Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target is under level 10.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Heal Ball.embed: {"title":"Heal Ball","description":"A caught Pok\u00e9mon will heal to Max HP immediately upon capture.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"-5"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.273"}}

Bait Attachment.embed: {"title":"Bait Attachment","description":"These attachments afix a piece of bait to the triggering device of a Pok\u00e9 Ball. When the bait is taken, the attachment automatically triggers a capture attempt along with any effect that would be caused by a Pok\u00e9 Ball Cases.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"300"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Zap Case.embed: {"title":"Zap Case","description":"Whenever a Pok\u00e9 Ball with a Zap Case hits a target it deals damage as if using a Struggle Attack. This Damage is Electric-Typed. If the Ball is already used as a Struggle Attack (such as with Curve Ball), then the Zap Case changes the damage to Electric-Type and adds bonus damage equal to twice the user\u2019s Technology Education skill. When attempting to catch Pok\u00e9mon, damage is resolved before the capture roll. This can also be used when releasing a Pok\u00e9mon (damage is resolved before the Pok\u00e9mon is released).","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1500"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Devil Case.embed: {"title":"Devil Case","description":"These dangerous and often illegal cases remove the failsafe on Pok\u00e9 Balls that prevents them from catching Pok\u00e9mon that are at 0 Hit Points or less. It allows Pok\u00e9 Balls to catch Fainted Pok\u00e9mon as normal, but automatically inflicts 2 Injuries when hitting a Pok\u00e9mon - whether the Capture is successful or not.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3000"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Tracking Chip.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Tracking Chip","description":"A chip embedded in the inner workings of the Pok\u00e9 Ball that emits a signal allowing the Ball\u2019s owner to remotely track the location of the Ball. Depending on the setting, these may be built in by default.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.46"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Alarm.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Alarm","description":"A belt with six slots for Pok\u00e9 Balls. Pok\u00e9 Balls affixed to the belt are locked in place with a number pad password to unlock them. Tampering with the belt triggers the password prompt, and failure to input the correct password within a minute triggers a loud alarm system.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.46"}}

Heat Ball.embed: {"title":"Heat Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Electric or Fire type.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Power Ball.embed: {"title":"Power Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target is under level 10.  Target gains 1d4 levels upon capture.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Medicine Case.embed: {"title":"Medicine Case","description":"A Medicine Case may be filled with an Antidote, Paralyze Heal, Burn Heal, Ice Heal, or Full Heal. This consumes the used item. When a Pok\u00e9mon is recalled into a Pok\u00e9 Ball with a filled Medicine Case, the item is automatically used on the Pok\u00e9mon. Filling a Medicine Case is an Standard Action. Medicine Cases may be refilled multiple times but may only have one sort of consumable in them at a time.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Lock Case.embed: {"title":"Lock Case","description":"A Lock Case grants a -10 Capture modifier to any Pok\u00e9 Ball. It also stops Pok\u00e9mon from exiting Pok\u00e9 Balls unless explicitly released by their owners.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"-10"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Contest Case.embed: {"title":"Contest Case","description":"Whenever a Pok\u00e9mon is released from a Contest Case into a Contest, they gain 1 Appeal Point during the introduction stage.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"400"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Camera Kit.embed: {"title":"Camera Kit","description":"A small camera, microphone, and speaker set affixed to the outside of a Pok\u00e9 Ball or Case. These allow a Trainer to remotely release and command their Pok\u00e9mon or attempt to capture a Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1200"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Flash Case.embed: {"title":"Flash Case","description":"When a Pok\u00e9 Ball with a Flash Case is thrown, it uses the Move Flash originating from the spot where it landed.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Haunt Ball.embed: {"title":"Haunt Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Dark or Ghost type.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Dusk Ball.embed: {"title":"Dusk Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if it is dark, or if there is very little light out, when used.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.273"}}

Bounce Case.embed: {"title":"Bounce Case","description":"A Pok\u00e9 Ball in a Bounce Case may bounce once when thrown or launched, up to a distance of 3 meters. This can be used to extend the effective range of a Pok\u00e9 Ball, hit around obstacles, or trigger effects such as the Capture Specialist\u2019s Curve Ball on an additional target.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Earth Ball.embed: {"title":"Earth Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Grass or Ground type.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Solid Ball.embed: {"title":"Solid Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Rock or Steel type.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Light Armor.embed: {"title":"Light Armor","description":"Grants 5 Damage Reduction against Physical Moves.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"8000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept: p.4"}}

Helmet.embed: {"title":"Helmet","description":"The user gains 15 Damage Reduction against Critical Hits.
