Fabulous Ball.embed: {"title":"Fabulous Ball","description":"The captured Pok\u00e9mon gains +2 dice in the Contest Stat that corresponds to the Stat boosted by their Nature. If the Stat boosted is HP, choose any two Contest Stats except the one corresponding to the lowered Stat and raise them by 1 die each. As a reminder, Beauty=SpAtk, Cool=Attack, Cute=Speed, Smart=SpDef, Tough=Def.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"-5"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Rain Ball.embed: {"title":"Rain Ball","description":"-20 Modifier if the weather is rainy when used.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"+0"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Learning Ball.embed: {"title":"Learning Ball","description":"The captured Pok\u00e9mon immediately learns their next level-up Move, as long as it is within 8 levels of their current level.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Modifier","value":"-5"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Dream Mist (Item).embed: {"title":"Dream Mist","description":"Dream Mist may be used as an AC 6 Melee Status Attack, performed as a Standard Action. If it hits, the target falls Asleep. Dream Mist is collected from Pok\u00e9mon with the eponymous Capability using a Collection Jar.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Sunglasses.embed: {"title":"Sunglasses","description":"+1 to Charm, Guile, and Intimidate Checks, to a maximum total modifier of +3.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Snow Boots.embed: {"title":"Snow Boots","description":"Snow Boots grant you the Naturewalk (Tundra) capability, but lower your Overland Speed by -1 while on ice or deep snow.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Feet"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Re-Breather.embed: {"title":"Re-Breather","description":"This small partial face mask allows Trainers and Pok\u00e9mon to breathe underwater as if they had the Gilled Capability for up to an hour. The Re-Breather is refilled automatically in 5 minutes while in open air.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Capture Styler.embed: {"title":"Capture Styler","description":"A Capture Styler is a Main-Hand specialized piece of equipment used by some certified Pok\u00e9mon Rangers in a region. It emits a string of energy that is used in a similar fashion to a lasso but is too weak to physically restrain a target. Instead, the energy has a calming effect on Pok\u00e9mon. Trainers using a Capture Styler may use Survival in place of Charm when raising the Disposition of Pok\u00e9mon.\nAcquiring a Capture Styler is easy for those who become certified Pok\u00e9mon Rangers; most qualified Rangers receive one as part of the job. They are not for sale to the general public, and it\u2019s easy to assume that someone who has a Capture Styler is a Ranger.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"7500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Cleanse Tag.embed:
{"title":"Cleanse Tag","description":"Small strips of paper with a prayer/incantation written on them. When created, the creator makes an Occult Ed Roll; this is the Cleanse Tag’s Power Value. When glued, taped, or nailed to a surface, they stop Pokémon or Trainers within 30m of the tag from Phasing through that surface unless they make a Focus check with a result exceeding the Tag’s Power Value. On a success, the tag is destroyed; on failure, the tag holds, and the encroacher cannot try again for at least an hour.
Tags may be stuck onto a weapon or appendage to let a Normal or Fighting-Type Attack hit a Ghost-Type Pokémon for neutral Damage; Tag is destroyed once damage is dealt.
Novice Occult Ed: Can burn tag as a Standard Action to remove Cursed, Suppressed, or Disabled condition from a single target within 5m.
Expert Occult Ed: Can burn tag to cause all with Invisibility and Phasing capabilities to make a Focus check; if result does not exceed tag's power value, capabilities lost for 5 min","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Wonder Launcher.embed: {"title":"Wonder Launcher","description":"This strange and complicated two-handed machine can only be used by those that have an Expert-Level Medicine or Technology Education Skill. The wielder can spend 1 AP to activate it, and apply an X-Item at a Pok\u00e9mon within 8 meters. X Items applied through the Wonder Launcher do not cause the target to forfeit any actions. Items combined by a Researcher may be used in the Wonder Launcher, and do not cause the target to forfeit any actions even if they are also a Restorative.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"10000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Caltrops.embed: {"title":"Caltrops","description":"Lets the user use the move Spikes as a Standard Action.  The item is then consumed.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Hand Net.embed: {"title":"Hand Net","description":"A long net, usually on the end of a long stick, these pieces of two-handed Equipment are usually used for bug catching or fishing. As an AC6 Status Attack, you may attempt to net a Small Pok\u00e9mon using this item. If you hit, you manage to scoop up the Pok\u00e9mon, trapping them. You may move with the Pok\u00e9mon, dragging them with you. Pok\u00e9mon may still attack from the Hand Net using long-range attacks, or try to attack the net itself, potentially breaking it and freeing themselves. Capture Rolls against Pok\u00e9mon in a net receive a -20 bonus.\nHand Nets with 50 Hit Points cost $100; 100 Hit Points cost $600; and 200 Hit Points cost $1500. Nets aren\u2019t broken until all of their Hit Points are depleted.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"Varies"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Toxic Caltrops.embed: {"title":"Toxic Caltrops","description":"Lets the user use the move Toxic Spikes as a Standard Action.  The item is then consumed.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Focus (Item).embed: {"title":"Focus","description":"A Focus grants +5 Bonus to a Stat, chosen when crafted. This Bonus is applied AFTER Combat Stages. Focuses are often Accessory-Slot Items, but may be crafted as Head-Slot, Hand or Off-Hand Slot Items as well; a Trainer may only benefit from one Focus at a time, regardless of the Equipment Slot. Focuses are not usually found in stores, but may sometimes be found for $6000 at your GM\u2019s discretion.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"6000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Snag Machine.embed: {"title":"Snag Machine","description":"Snag Machines are extremely illegal machines that allow trainers to steal another Trainer\u2019s Pok\u00e9mon. They come in both large, immovable varieties and smaller portable varieties. The Portable Variety is an Accessory-Slot Item. Inserting a Pok\u00e9 Ball into a Large Snag Machine turns it into a Snag Ball permanently, but Large Snag Machines may only turn 5 Pok\u00e9 Balls into Snag Balls per day. Inserting a Pok\u00e9 Ball into a Portable Snag Machine, which is a Swift Action, turns it into a Snag Ball after one round, but only for that round. Snag Balls have the same properties as the Pok\u00e9 Ball type they were before being inserted into the machine, but receive a -2 penalty on all Pok\u00e9 Ball attack rolls, and are capable of capturing owned Pok\u00e9mon. Snag Machines cannot be bought in stores, but may sell on the black market for prices of $30,000 or more.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"30000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Mega Ring.embed: {"title":"Mega Ring","description":"Mega Rings are extraordinarily rare accessories that allow a Trainer\u2019s Pok\u00e9mon to Mega Evolve when used in conjunction with a Mega Stone. They cannot be bought in stores anywhere and must usually be earned through a trial of sorts, governed by a Gym Leader or other influential Pok\u00e9mon Trainer. They can take the form of a bracelet, a necklace, or an actual ring.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"N\/A"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Lifting Frame.embed: {"title":"Lifting Frame","description":"A mechanized frame worn over each arm with motorized muscles. Grants +2 to Power Capability. The frames are too unwieldy to use other equipment such as weapons while wearing them.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main + Off Hand"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Spacesuit.embed: {"title":"Spacesuit","description":"Grants Vacuum Immunity and Free Floating 4. Weighs 200 pounds and is thus difficult for most Trainers to use in normal gravity. A Robotic Age upgraded version costing an extra $2000 confers Hazard Immunity too and weighs only 100 pounds instead.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"8000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body + Head"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Hazmat Suit.embed: {"title":"Hazmat Suit","description":"Acts as a Gas Mask but also grants the Hazard Immunity capability and immunity to non-damaging Poison Type Moves.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body + Head"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Pester Balls.embed: {"title":"Pester Balls","description":"Pester Balls are small balls full of chemicals that come in six varieties, each of which inflicts a different Status Affliction when they hit a target. The Status Afflictions they can cause are: Rage, Confusion, Burn, Poison, Paralysis, and Sleep.\nAfter being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Rage.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Rage","description":"Inflicts Rage on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Confusion.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Confusion","description":"Inflicts Confusion on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Poison.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Poison","description":"Inflicts Poison on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Cannon.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Cannon","description":"Increases Pok\u00e9 Ball and Pester Ball accuracy by +1 and range to 15 meters. Balls deal 2d6 unreducible damage upon hitting a target. Balls take a Shift Action to ready in the Pok\u00e9 Ball Cannon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main + Off Hand"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.41"}}

Extendable Grabby Arm.embed: {"title":"Extendable Grabby Arm","description":"A dexterous and flexible arm with a hand at the end. Can be used to grab and manipulate objects from 3 meters away.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"750"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main Hand"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Pester Ball: Burn.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Burn","description":"Inflicts Burn on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Paralysis.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Paralysis","description":"Inflicts Paralysis on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Sleep.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Sleep","description":"Causes the target to fall asleep. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Treecko Gear.embed: {"title":"Treecko Gear","description":"Grants the Wallclimber capability.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main + Off Hand, Feet"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Thermal Dampening Suit.embed: {"title":"Thermal Dampening Suit","description":"The user is invisible to thermal imaging gear.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Thermal Goggles.embed: {"title":"Thermal Goggles","description":"Allows you to see in the IR spectrum, enabling you to easily pick out a person or Pok\u00e9mon in camouflage or to identify sources of heat.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Smoke Ball.embed: {"title":"Smoke Ball","description":"When used, a Smoke Ball creates a 3 meter blast that fills the area with smoke, as if the move Smokescreen had been used. Smoke Balls can only be found in specialty shops.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Anomaly Detector.embed: {"title":"Anomaly Detector","description":"When pointed at a person, Pok\u00e9mon, or object, this handheld device can determine whether or not it belongs to this timeline or parallel universe. It gives no indication to the nature of the home universe, however.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2150"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Item"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

X-Ray Goggles.embed: {"title":"X-Ray Goggles","description":"Grants the user the X-Ray Vision Capability.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"8000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Pok\u00e9radar.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9radar","description":"Contrary to its name, this handheld device actually detects both human and Pok\u00e9mon lifesigns in a 20 meter radius and can display their relative location to you on a screen. No information is given about specific species.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"5000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Gravity Modulation Suit.embed: {"title":"Gravity Modulation Suit","description":"You may treat the local gravity as if it were 1 lower or 1 higher. Changing the setting on the suit is an At-Will Extended Action requiring time for the suit to adjust to the new settings.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"4000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Universal Translator.embed: {"title":"Universal Translator","description":"You understand any spoken language recognized by the Universal Translator and can speak into it and have your words translated immediately. Usually programmed with all of the major human languages. Can be used to speak with Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"10000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Scrubbing Spray.embed: {"title":"Scrubbing Spray","description":"Sprays a chemical agent over an area that destroys most forensic evidence, such as trace biomatter. Perception checks to track someone or to search for forensic evidence take a -6 penalty. Requires a Scrub Cartridge to use. Comes with 1 Cartridge. More can be bought for 300 apiece.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Zap Blaster.embed: {"title":"Zap Blaster","description":"Uses the Move Zap Cannon once.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

Sting Grenade.embed: {"title":"Sting Grenade","description":"Throwing a Sting Grenade is an AC 4 Ranged Blast 3 attack that can be made at a target within your Pok\u00e9 Ball throwing range. Upon connecting, the Sting Grenade releases dozens of hard rubber balls around it, causing pain to the targets but no damage. Those targets take a -3 penalty to all rolls and to their evasion until the start of your next turn.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"250"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

Flashbang.embed: {"title":"Flashbang","description":"Throwing a Flashbang uses the Move Flash originating from the point where you threw the Flashbang, up to your maximum Pok\u00e9 Ball throwing range. When used in this way, Flash flinches all legal targets on 19-20 on Accuracy Check.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"250"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

EMP Grenade.embed: {"title":"EMP Grenade","description":"Throwing an EMP Grenade is an AC 5 Ranged Blast 3 attack that can be made at a target within your Pok\u00e9 Ball throwing range. All legal targets with Augmentations immediately suffer the effects of Augmentation Shock. EMP Grenades flinch targets with Augmentations on a roll of 18+ on Accuracy Check. EMP Grenades disable Pok\u00e9bots for 1d2 turns.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

Mesh Shielding.embed: {"title":"Mesh Shielding","description":"An advanced anti-conductive fabric woven into a stiff jacket designed to shield sensitive electronics from damage and electrical shock. You gain 5 Damage Reduction against Electric Type damage. Whenever you would suffer Augmentation Shock, roll 1d2. On a 1, you suffer no ill effects.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"8000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Flame Retardant Armor.embed: {"title":"Flame Retardant Armor","description":"You gain 10 Damage Reduction against Fire Type damage.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"5000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Ablative Heavy Armor.embed: {"title":"Ablative Heavy Armor","description":"A weighty but brittle armor that is self-repairing. Grants 20 Damage Reduction, but each damaging attack removes 5 Damage Reduction from the armor. Every five minutes, the armor repairs 5 Damage Reduction. The user\u2019s Speed Combat Stage defaults to -1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"14500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Sonic Filter.embed: {"title":"Sonic Filter","description":"Creates a portable field of directed white noise with a 2 meter radius when activated. Anyone within can hold a conversation normally, but anyone outside the field just hears static coming from the direction of the wearer. Moves with the Sonic Keyword aimed at a target within the field require 2 more on Accuracy Roll to hit.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2500"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Glitch Detection Crystal.embed: {"title":"Glitch Detection Crystal","description":"A crystal necklace which begins to display pixelated effects and static when near Glitch phenomena. Pixellation and static effects intensify proportionally to proximity to the phenomena.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"800"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Pheromone Cartridge.embed: {"title":"Pheromone Cartridge","description":"A cartridge for the Pheromone Emitter.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"250"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Pheromone Emitter.embed: {"title":"Pheromone Emitter","description":"Emits pheromones as a Swift Action that give a +4 bonus to a Charm or Intimidate check against wild Pok\u00e9mon. Requires a Pheromone Cartridge to use. Comes with 1 Cartridge. More can be bought for 250 apiece.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Cap Cannon.embed: {"title":"Cap Cannon","description":"Capsule Cannons - or Cap Cannons for short - are two-handed pieces of Equipment which can be loaded with different types of Capsules (Caps) and fired. They can be fired as a Standard Action, and the range and effect of the Cannon depends on the Cap used. A Cap Cannon may have up to five Caps loaded in it at once, and they do not have to be fired in any particular order. You may load up to two Caps into a Cannon as a Standard Action. There are three types of Caps: Bean Caps, Glue Caps, and Net Caps. In addition to Caps, Capsule Cannons can also be loaded with Smoke Bombs, Pester Balls, and Poke Balls. When fired this way, these items behave normally but have a Range of 10 meters.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"5000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.6"}}

Bean Cap.embed:
{"title":"Bean Cap","description":"
AC: (6 minus Tech Edu Rank, Min 2)
Range: 10 meters
Effect: The target takes 20 Physical, Normal-Type Damage. On 18+, the target is Tripped and loses a Tick of Hit Points.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"50"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.6"}}

Net Cap.embed:
{"title":"Net Cap","description":"
AC: (10 minus Tech Edu Rank)
Range: 6 Meters
Effect: Targets hit by a Net Cap gain all the effects below while the net remains on them. Targets may attempt to remove the Net as a Standard Action; if they do, they make a Save Check with a DC of 15, adding their Power Capability as a bonus to their Roll. Targets may automatically remove the Net as an Extended Action.
» If the target is a Wild Pokémon, Capture Rate is increased by +20
» If the target is Large Size or smaller, they take a -3 penalty to Accuracy Rolls
» If the target is Medium Size or smaller, they are Slowed and Vulnerable
» Sky and Levitate Speeds cannot be used; the target is forced to lower themselves to the ground (without taking fall damage).","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"200"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.6"}}

How Berries??.embed: {"title":"How Berries??","description":"A beginner\u2019s guide to the proper care of berry plants.\nRank 1 - Adept General Education: Once per day when making a Yield Roll, add +1 to the result.\nRank 2 - Expert General Education: You may create Mulch from Food Scrap.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Shield (Item).embed: {"title":"Shield","description":"A Shield is an Off-Hand defensive item held in one hand or braced to an arm. They grant grant +1 Evasion. They may be readied as a Standard Action to instead grant +4 Evasion and 10 Damage Reduction until the end of your next turn, but also cause you to become Slowed for that duration. If used Two-Handed, Shields can also function as a Small Melee Weapon.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"3000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept: p.4"}}

Special Armor.embed: {"title":"Light Armor","description":"Grants 5 Damage Reduction against Special Moves.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"8000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept: p.4"}}

Heavy Armor.embed: {"title":"Heavy Armor","description":"Heavy Armor grants +5 Damage Reduction. Heavy Armor causes the wearer\u2019s Speed\u2019s Default Combat Stage to be -1.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"12000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept: p.4"}}

Slipstream Armor.embed: {"title":"Slipstream Armor","description":"A flexible and smooth light armor that can momentarily become nearly frictionless. Grants 5 Damage Reduction. Once a battle, the wearer may use a Swift Action to escape from being Stuck.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"10000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Reinforced Trenchcoat.embed: {"title":"Reinforced Trenchcoat","description":"A stylish utility version of Light Armor. Grants 5 Damage Reduction and provides a +4 bonus to Stealth checks to conceal weapons and prevents their detection by metal detectors.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"10000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Glue Cap.embed:
{"title":"Glue Cap","description":"
AC: (8 minus Tech Edu Rank, Min 2)
Range: 8 meters
Effect: Cause the target to become Slowed, and their Initiative is lowered by 5. On 18+, the target is also Stuck and Trapped.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"100"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.6"}}

Guard Spec.embed: {"title":"Guard Spec","description":"Prevents reduction of Combat Stages or Accuracy on the Pok\u00e9mon for 5 Turns","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"700"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.276"}}

Sensor Disruption Vest.embed: {"title":"Sensor Disruption Vest","description":"The specially designed material of this vest wreaks havoc with the sensors used on most Pok\u00e9bot models and Eye Augmentations. Pok\u00e9bots and any Trainers or Pok\u00e9mon with an Eye Augmentation suffer a -2 penalty to their single target Accuracy Checks made against the wearer.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"2000"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Study Manual.embed: {"title":"Study Manual","description":"A Study Manual is always assigned to a single Skill and covers a specific narrow field that can be taken as a Skill Stunt.\nRank 1 - Novice General Education: You gain a Skill Stunt in the associated Skill of the Study Manual covering the narrow field specified by the Study Manual.\nRank 2 - Expert General Education: You gain a general +2 Bonus to the associated Skill. This Bonus does not stack with other bonuses from Books or Equipment to the same Skill.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.7"}}

Bandages.embed: {"title":"Bandages","description":"Bandages are applied as Extended Actions on Pok\u00e9mon or Trainers. Bandages last for 6 hours; while applied, they double the Natural Healing Rate of Pok\u00e9mon or Trainers, meaning a Pok\u00e9mon or Trainer will heal 1\/8th of their Hit Points per half hour. Bandages also immediately heal one Injury if they remain in place for their full duration.\nIf a Pok\u00e9mon is damaged or loses Hit Points in any way, the Bandages immediately stop working.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"300"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.277"}}

Adorable Fashion.embed: {"title":"Adorable Fashion","description":"The holder may activate this item once a Scene as a Free Action to gain +2 Evasion for one full round.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"500"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.138"}}

Pok\u00e9dex.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9dex","description":"A hand-held computer with an advanced camera and image recognition software given to trainers at the start of their journey.  A trainer can use a Standard Action to identify a Pok\u00e9mon within 10m using the Pok\u00e9dex's scanner.  Doing so reveals the average height\/weight of the species, height\/weight of the target, moves that the Species learns through Level Up, and some brief facts about the species' behavior.\nPok\u00e9dexes may also function as smartphones, and in most circumstances they should be made available for free to starting characters.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"12000"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.271"}}

Traditional Medicine Reference.embed: {"title":"Traditional Medicine Reference","description":"A volume dedicated to properly preparing herbal medications. See PTU May 2015 Playtest Packet - Miscellaneous Errata for Herbal Restorative errata.\nRank 1 - Adept Medicine Education: Targets you administer Herbal Restoratives to do not lose Combat Stages no matter how many Herbal Restoratives they\u2019ve had in the same day.\nRank 2 - Expert Medicine Education: Whenever you administer an Herbal Restorative to a target, they may choose to gain the Food Buff associated with Herbal Restoratives, regardless of how many Herbal Restoratives they\u2019ve used this day.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Bait.embed: {"title":"Bait","description":"Bait is a tasty, strong-smelling morsel of food designed to attract Pok\u00e9mon. It may be used in two ways; to lure Pok\u00e9mon, or to distract Pok\u00e9mon.\nTo lure Pok\u00e9mon, set the bait on a route. Every 15 minutes thereafter, roll 1d20 until you roll 15 or higher. If you roll 3 times without success, the bait loses its potency and fails. If you succeed however, a random Pok\u00e9mon will appear. Bait is often used for Fishing in this way.\nTo distract Pok\u00e9mon, throw it at a Wild Pok\u00e9mon as a Standard Action. The target must then make a Focus Roll with a DC of 12. If they fail, the Pok\u00e9mon gives up its next Standard Action to eat the food.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"250"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.274"}}

Tinfoil Gospel: Your Primer on Thwarting.embed: {"title":"Tinfoil Gospel: Your Primer on Thwarting the Conspiracies of the New World Order","description":"An even more questionable tome, filled with laughable conspiracy theories. Its mental exercises are strangely effective, however.\nRank 1 - Novice Occult Education: You gain the Iron Mind Edge and the Skill Stunt - Focus (resisting Telepathy).\nRank 2 - Expert Occult Education: Your Aura becomes muddled and difficult to read. Pok\u00e9mon and Trainers with the Aura Reader Capability cannot discern the tint of your Aura and must succeed on an opposed Intuition or Focus Check vs your Occult Education or Focus in order to read the hue of your Aura. Upon failure, they may not attempt to read your Aura again for the remainder of the Scene.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.8"}}

Leftovers.embed: {"title":"Leftovers","description":"Snack. When their Digestion Buff is traded in, the user recovers 1\/16th of their max Hit Points at the beginning of each turn for the rest of the encounter.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"350"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

The Anarchist Cookbook.embed: {"title":"The Anarchist Cookbook","description":"The simple act of owning this book isn\u2019t illegal, but carrying out its suggestions might be.\nRank 1 - Novice Technology Education: Whenever you apply a Repel to a target, they become Blinded until the end of their next turn. This may only affect a target once per Scene.\nRank 2 - Expert Technology Education: Whenever you hit a target with a Repel or Pester Ball, they lose Hit Points equal to your Technology Education Rank.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"1000"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.9"}}
